sense.def: Illness Sign of a frequent occurrence of dry retching. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 18: 胃蟲，令人嘔吐，胃 逆喜噦 , “A stomach bug causes vomiting. The stomach [qi] flows contrary [to its normal direction] and one has a tendency to retch . Xia 下 , discharge; let-down; to ingest [medication] [p]

a) of pus, blood, water or watery stool discharged through the anus. Su wen 素問 28: 帝曰：腸澼下白沫何如？岐伯曰：脈沉則生，脈浮則死 , “[Huang] Di: ‘In the case of intestinal flush discharging pus and blood, how is that?’ Qi Bo: ‘When the [movement in the] vessels is suspended and interrupted, then [the patient] will die ’”.

b) Of water, stones, and water discharged through the urinary tract. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 21: 當下石子如豆卵，以石盡止 , “This will cause discharge of stones of a size ranging from beans to eggs. Stop once all stones have left”. c.) Of blood, water, leucorrhea, or any turbid matter, as well as fetus or placenta discharged from a female’s genital tract. Jin gui yao lue 金匱要略 Lj: 婦人經水閉不利，臟堅癖不 止，中有乾血，下白物，礬石丸主之 , “When a woman’s period fails to flow, and when her uterus continuously develops hardenings of aggregation-illness, and if this includes dried blood and the discharge of white matter, pills with fan shi will master this”.

② Therapeutic Approach a) of applying medication to stimulate defecation, discharge of liquids, or the smoothening of intestinal passage to cure accumulations in the stomach and intestines, hardening of stools, stagnating liquids, as well as repletion heat accumulation. Shang han lun 傷寒論 36: 太陽與陽明合病，喘而胸滿者，不可下，宜麻 黃湯 , “When the major yang [conduit] and yang brilliant [conduit] are both affected by a disease, and when [patients] pant and have a feeling of fullness in their chest, and are unable to discharge [urine and stools], the decoction with ma huang is appropriate”.b) Of all therapies meant to pass down something, including hastening delivery, stimulating lactation, transforming accumulations, stimulating the outflow of liquids, mildly removing extravascular blood, stimulating the passage of qi, etc. Ru men shi qin 儒門事親 2: 催生下乳、磨積逐水、破經泄氣，凡下 行者，皆下法也 , “To hasten delivery and stimulate the let-down of lactation, to grind accumulations and to discharge water, to break through conduits and cause the outflow of qi, all these [methods of] stimulating a discharge are ‘methods of discharging [matter] ’”.c) Of all aggressive therapies meant to stimulate the discharge of pathological body products, such as to remove phlegm, pus, extravascular blood, gu poison, etc. Shen nong ben cao jing 神農本草經 Substance Entry jia su 假蘇：破結聚氣，下瘀血，除濕 痹 , “It breaks through nodular collections of qi, discharges stagnant blood, and eliminates moisture blockages”. ③ The intake of medication. Jin gui yao lue 金匱要略 Lj: 煉蜜和丸梧子大，酒下十五丸 , “Smelt with honey and prepare pills of the size of wu seeds. Ingest 15 pills with wine”.
